definition: to depict/to trace (a drawing)/to copy/to touch up
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China/surname Miao
to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
to trace over red characters (as a method of learning to write)

sentences.english: Apply a 1px outside stroke with #8b8782 color.
I do believe she had eye shadow on.
sentences.chinese: 我懷疑她準是描了黑眼圈。

sentences.english: The parameters were recorded by MedLab Biological Signal Collection System.
sentences.chinese: 採用生物信號採集處理系統分析描記法進行研究。

sentences.english: Trace-off pattern adding seam allowances. Cut generally around the pattern.
sentences.chinese: 復描紙樣加縫份後剪下紙樣。

sentences.english: Trace all the words from a book with a pen.
sentences.chinese: 拿筆把一本書上的字描一遍。

sentences.english: She mimicked a traditional Chinese painting on paper.
sentences.chinese: 她在紙上描了一幅國畫。

sentences.english: Noticed that your description says Speed but the pictured item is Bikila.
sentences.chinese: 注意到你的描述說速度，但圖爲項目是比基拉。

definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to draw designs, maps etc/picture (e.g. of life in the city)
to put pen to paper/pen mark
to dye/to catch (a disease)/to acquire (bad habits etc)/to contaminate/to add color washes to a painting
ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead
surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico
to apply makeup to the eyebrows/(bird species of China) Chinese hwamei (Garrulax canorus)
